ygData.subject: Re: Please give me a reason to play
ygData.msgSnippet: Or it could make you realize why you re bored with your bard. While I like my bard character, getting into another role really changed my disappointment with
ygData.messageBody:
Or it could make you realize why you're bored with your bard. While I like
my bard character, getting into another role really changed my
disappointment with the game. I also suggest you pick one of the newer
servers so you don't see the huge gap among players your level due to
twinking. That alone makes a big difference.

-----Original Message-----
From: Blitz Krieg [mailto:blitz_krieg@...]
Sent: Sunday, May 16, 1999 12:12 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Please give me a reason to play


From: "Blitz Krieg" <blitz_krieg@...>

Also, if you feel somewhat tired of the <gasp> Bard class right now, you
think you've done and seen it all.... Remember you've got 7 other character
spots (and over a hundred on all available servers) to try your hand at the
things you've seen others do, that you wished you could, too! A small
period of time in another shell should be enuf to remind you why you were a
Bard in the first place. :)


> The dungeons are the big thing. Being level 17 I'd assume you haven't been
>in Cazic-Thule or Solusek? There are some nice things in there that are
>better than bronze plate and combines. Keep going till you have full
>Rubicite (or Emerald) and a pair of Demon Claws. =)
>
> Good Journey,
>
> Sineras Silverlyre (Cazic-Thule)
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: David Rubino [mailto:tigger@...]
>Sent: Sunday, May 16, 1999 2:24 AM
>To: eqbards@onelist.com
>Subject: [eqbards] Please give me a reason to play
>
>
>From: David Rubino <tigger@...>
>
>
>Hello all . . .
>
>I am a Level 17 Bard. As such I am about that age where I have almost
>completed my set of bronze armor. I already have 2 combine longswords, so
>pretty soon I'll be as equipped as I ever really need to be.
>
>To those of you who have reached and passed this point in the game, I would
>like to know what it is that keeps you going? I've seen basically every
>zone, got everything I need. In real life this is the time I would finally
>settle down and spend time with my family.
>
>Just looking for tips on what to do now . . .
>
>-Musil
>
>
